thread.title: Four-year-old boy saves mother's life by dialling 999 using Siri
thread.title_full: Four-year-old boy saves mother's life by dialling 999 using Siri

author: Sean Morrison
title: Four-year-old boy saves mother's life by dialling 999 using Siri
text:
Redknapp: ‘Defoe has every right to go to another World Cup’ 
Police have released a heart-breaking 999 call in which a four-year-old boy told an emergency services worker he couldn't wake his mother up because he feared she was dead. 
The distressing recording was released after medics were able to save the woman's life thanks to the young boy's quick thinking. 
After his mother collapsed the child managed to unlock his mother’s phone by pressing her thumb on its fingerprint lock. 
He then used the phone’s ‘Siri’ function, saying ‘help’, which then connected the youngster to the emergency services. 
After the call handler asked him where his mother was, the boy, named Roman, said he thought she was dead because "she's closing her eyes and she's not breathing". 
The boy was able to give the call handler the correct address which saved police vital minutes in being able to send officers to the house straight away. 
Thirteen minutes after receiving the call, officers arrived and managed to force entry to the Croydon home. 
There they found Roman with his twin brother and younger brother all inside with their mum, who was lying unconscious on the floor. 
Paramedics were able to give first aid to the woman and she was taken to hospital after regaining consciousness at the home. Read more
